01570 
01572 // AvgStripSize()
01573 //
01574 // Finds the average strip size of the input vector of strips
01575 //
01576 float NvStripifier::AvgStripSize( const NvStripInfoVec &strips ){
01577         int sizeAccum = 0;
01578         int numStrips = strips.size();
01579         for ( int i = 0; i < numStrips; i++ ){
01580                 NvStripInfo *strip = strips[ i ];
01581                 sizeAccum += strip->m_faces.size();
01582                 sizeAccum -= strip->m_numDegenerates;
01583         }
01584         return ( ( float )sizeAccum ) / ( ( float )numStrips );
01585 }
01586 
01587 
01589 // FindAllStrips()
01590 //
01591 // Does the stripification, puts output strips into vector allStrips
01592 //
01593 // Works by setting runnning a number of experiments in different areas of the mesh, and
01594 //  accepting the one which results in the longest strips.  It then accepts this, and moves
01595 //  on to a different area of the mesh.  We try to jump around the mesh some, to ensure that
01596 //  large open spans of strips get generated.
01597 //
01598 void NvStripifier::FindAllStrips( NvStripInfoVec &allStrips,
01599                                                                  NvFaceInfoVec &allFaceInfos,
01600                                                                  NvEdgeInfoVec &allEdgeInfos,
01601                                                                  int numSamples ){
01602         // the experiments
01603         int experimentId = 0;
01604         int stripId      = 0;
01605         bool done        = false;
01606 
01607         int loopCtr = 0;
01608         
01609         while ( !done )
01610         {
01611                 loopCtr++;
01612                 
01613                 //
01614                 // PHASE 1: Set up numSamples * numEdges experiments
01615                 //
01616                 NvStripInfoVec *experiments = new NvStripInfoVec [ numSamples * 6 ];
01617                 int experimentIndex = 0;
01618                 std::set   <NvFaceInfo*>  resetPoints;
01619                 int i = 0;
01620                 for ( ; i < numSamples; i++ )
01621                 {
01622                         
01623                         // Try to find another good reset point.
01624                         // If there are none to be found, we are done
01625                         NvFaceInfo *nextFace = FindGoodResetPoint( allFaceInfos, allEdgeInfos );
01626                         if ( nextFace == NULL ){
01627                                 done = true;
01628                                 break;
01629                         }
01630                         // If we have already evaluated starting at this face in this slew
01631                         // of experiments, then skip going any further
01632                         else if ( resetPoints.find( nextFace ) != resetPoints.end() ){
01633                                 continue;
01634                         }
01635                         
01636                         // trying it now...
01637                         resetPoints.insert( nextFace );
01638                         
01639                         // otherwise, we shall now try experiments for starting on the 01,12, and 20 edges
01640                         assert( nextFace->m_stripId < 0 );
01641                         
01642                         // build the strip off of this face's 0-1 edge
01643                         NvEdgeInfo *edge01 = FindEdgeInfo( allEdgeInfos, nextFace->m_v0, nextFace->m_v1 );
01644                         NvStripInfo *strip01 = new NvStripInfo( NvStripStartInfo( nextFace, edge01, true ), stripId++, experimentId++ );
01645                         experiments[ experimentIndex++ ].push_back( strip01 );
01646                         
01647                         // build the strip off of this face's 1-0 edge
01648                         NvEdgeInfo *edge10 = FindEdgeInfo( allEdgeInfos, nextFace->m_v0, nextFace->m_v1 );
01649                         NvStripInfo *strip10 = new NvStripInfo( NvStripStartInfo( nextFace, edge10, false ), stripId++, experimentId++ );
01650                         experiments[ experimentIndex++ ].push_back( strip10 );
01651                         
01652                         // build the strip off of this face's 1-2 edge
01653                         NvEdgeInfo *edge12 = FindEdgeInfo( allEdgeInfos, nextFace->m_v1, nextFace->m_v2 );
01654                         NvStripInfo *strip12 = new NvStripInfo( NvStripStartInfo( nextFace, edge12, true ), stripId++, experimentId++ );
01655                         experiments[ experimentIndex++ ].push_back( strip12 );
01656                         
01657                         // build the strip off of this face's 2-1 edge
01658                         NvEdgeInfo *edge21 = FindEdgeInfo( allEdgeInfos, nextFace->m_v1, nextFace->m_v2 );
01659                         NvStripInfo *strip21 = new NvStripInfo( NvStripStartInfo( nextFace, edge21, false ), stripId++, experimentId++ );
01660                         experiments[ experimentIndex++ ].push_back( strip21 );
01661                         
01662                         // build the strip off of this face's 2-0 edge
01663                         NvEdgeInfo *edge20 = FindEdgeInfo( allEdgeInfos, nextFace->m_v2, nextFace->m_v0 );
01664                         NvStripInfo *strip20 = new NvStripInfo( NvStripStartInfo( nextFace, edge20, true ), stripId++, experimentId++ );
01665                         experiments[ experimentIndex++ ].push_back( strip20 );
01666                         
01667                         // build the strip off of this face's 0-2 edge
01668                         NvEdgeInfo *edge02 = FindEdgeInfo( allEdgeInfos, nextFace->m_v2, nextFace->m_v0 );
01669                         NvStripInfo *strip02 = new NvStripInfo( NvStripStartInfo( nextFace, edge02, false ), stripId++, experimentId++ );
01670                         experiments[ experimentIndex++ ].push_back( strip02 );
01671                 }
01672                 
01673                 //
01674                 // PHASE 2: Iterate through that we setup in the last phase
01675                 // and really build each of the strips and strips that follow to see how
01676                 // far we get
01677                 //
01678                 int numExperiments = experimentIndex;
01679                 for ( i = 0; i < numExperiments; i++ ){
01680                         
01681                         // get the strip set
01682                         
01683                         // build the first strip of the list
01684                         experiments[ i ][ 0 ]->Build( allEdgeInfos, allFaceInfos );
01685                         int experimentId = experiments[ i ][ 0 ]->m_experimentId;
01686                         
01687                         NvStripInfo *stripIter = experiments[ i ][ 0 ];
01688                         NvStripStartInfo startInfo( NULL, NULL, false );
01689                         while ( FindTraversal( allFaceInfos, allEdgeInfos, stripIter, startInfo ) ){
01690                                 
01691                                 // create the new strip info
01692                                 stripIter = new NvStripInfo( startInfo, stripId++, experimentId );
01693                                 
01694                                 // build the next strip
01695                                 stripIter->Build( allEdgeInfos, allFaceInfos );
01696                                 
01697                                 // add it to the list
01698                                 experiments[ i ].push_back( stripIter );
01699                         }
01700                 }
01701                 
01702                 //
01703                 // Phase 3: Find the experiment that has the most promise
01704                 //
01705                 int bestIndex = 0;
01706                 double bestValue = 0;
01707                 for ( i = 0; i < numExperiments; i++ )
01708                 {
01709                         const float avgStripSizeWeight = 1.0f;
01710                         const float numTrisWeight      = 0.0f;
01711                         const float numStripsWeight    = 0.0f;
01712                         float avgStripSize = AvgStripSize( experiments[ i ] );
01713                         float numStrips    = ( float ) experiments[ i ].size();
01714                         float value        = avgStripSize * avgStripSizeWeight + ( numStrips * numStripsWeight );
01715                         //float value = 1.f / numStrips;
01716                         //float value = numStrips * avgStripSize;
01717                                 
01718                         if ( value > bestValue )
01719                         {
01720                                 bestValue = value;
01721                                 bestIndex = i;
01722                         }
01723                 }
01724 
01725                 //
01726                 // Phase 4: commit the best experiment of the bunch
01727                 //
01728                 CommitStrips( allStrips, experiments[ bestIndex ] );
01729                 
01730                 // and destroy all of the others
01731                 for ( i = 0; i < numExperiments; i++ )
01732                 {
01733                         if ( i != bestIndex )
01734                         {
01735                                 int numStrips = experiments[ i ].size();
01736                                 for ( int j = 0; j < numStrips; j++ )
01737                                 {
01738                                         NvStripInfo* currStrip = experiments[ i ][ j ];
01739                                         //delete all bogus faces in the experiments
01740                                         for ( int k = 0; k < currStrip->m_faces.size(); ++k )
01741                                         {
01742                                                 if( currStrip->m_faces[ k ]->m_bIsFake )
01743                                                 {
01744                                                         delete currStrip->m_faces[ k ], currStrip->m_faces[ k ] = NULL;
01745                                                 }
01746                                         }
01747                                         delete currStrip, currStrip = NULL, experiments[ i ][ j ] = NULL;
01748                                 }
01749                         }
01750                 }
01751                 
01752                 // delete the array that we used for all experiments
01753                 delete [] experiments;
01754   }
01755 }
01756 
01757 
01759 // CountRemainingTris()
01760 //
01761 // This will count the number of triangles left in the
01762 // strip list starting at iter and finishing up at end
01763 //
01764 int NvStripifier::CountRemainingTris( std::list<NvStripInfo*>::iterator iter,
01765                                                                                         std::list<NvStripInfo*>::iterator  end ){
01766         int count = 0;
01767         while ( iter != end ){
01768                 count += ( *iter )->m_faces.size();
01769                 iter++;
01770         }
01771         return count;
01772 }
